summary:
Aspirin, or acetylsalicylic acid, is a medicine used to relieve pain, reduce fever, and decrease inflammation. It can also prevent blood clots and help people with heart problems. You might take it for a headache or to stop a fever.

This drug has been around for a long time, with early forms found in willow tree bark. The modern version was made in a lab in the 1800s. It's widely available and one of the most commonly used medicines worldwide. However, it can cause side effects like stomach problems and shouldn't be used by everyone, especially children and pregnant women, without a doctor's advice.
title: Aspirin
